Class Driver

java.lang.Object
  Driver

public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object

Driver for HW 1 on singly linked lists. The purpose of this code file is to drive a doubly-linked list class and verify that the code of the DLL works as it should. The "application" for testing is a phonebook of individual records. To perform the test, we do the following: 1. open an input file and a log file (with file names hard-coded); 2. dump the empty phonebook to show that we can dump an empty DLL; 3. run a loop on the input file, reading in records and adding the data as nodes in the DLL, testing a record to see if it's in the phonebook, or deleting it from the phonebook. Note that the input data resembles data that might be submitted to a database system. This documentation indicates that the driver program knows that underneath the phonebook is a DLL, but the code is ignorant of this. The code in this file knows only about adding, containing, and removing records. Copyright (C) 2011 by Duncan A. Buell. All rights reserved.

Version:
1.00 2011-01-11

Duncan A. Buell
